p: Unlike adults, children with COVID-19 have milder symptoms and better clinical outcomes [22]; among the COVID-19 patients under 18Â years of age, children under one year old seem to be at the highest risk of the severe form of the disease [23]. Although early studies showed that children with COVID-19 were less likely to develop severe symptoms than other age groups, one new study has shown that children are as likely to develop COVID-19 as adults [24]. So, prevention and finding appropriate treatment for children is as important as for adults.
